headline: F1 Owner Liberty Media To Spin Off Entertainment Assets as CEO Steps Down
summary: Liberty Media said it plans to spin off most of its entertainment assets besides Formula One into a separate, publicly traded entity, and announced that CEO Greg Maffei is stepping down.

headline: Liberty Deal Looks Favorable for Charter as Malone Simplifies His Empire
summary: Charter Communications  ’ long-awaited deal to buy  Liberty  Broadband in an all-stock transaction looks like a win for Charter investors.  Charter effectively will buy Liberty Broadband, whose main asset is a roughly 26% stake in the country’s second-largest cable company, at a discount of more than 15% to its net asset value, Barron’s estimates.  The Charter-friendly deal bears the imprint of John Malone, 83, who was the controlling shareholder of Liberty Broadband and thus the most influential voice at Charter.

raw.headline: Liberty Deal Looks Favorable for Charter as Malone Simplifies His Empire
raw.summary: Charter Communications  ’ long-awaited deal to buy  Liberty  Broadband in an all-stock transaction looks like a win for Charter investors.  Charter effectively will buy Liberty Broadband, whose main asset is a roughly 26% stake in the country’s second-largest cable company, at a discount of more than 15% to its net asset value, Barron’s estimates.  The Charter-friendly deal bears the imprint of John Malone, 83, who was the controlling shareholder of Liberty Broadband and thus the most influential voice at Charter.

headline: Liberty Media sharpens F1 focus with spinoff as Malone set to take driver's seat
summary: (Reuters) -Formula One owner Liberty Media will sharpen its focus on its motorsports businesses by spinning off most of its other assets and said Chairman John Malone would become the interim CEO when its long-time top boss steps down at the end of 2024.  Greg Maffei, who spearheaded the company's rapid expansion across the media, communications, sports and entertainment sectors during his nearly two decades at the helm, will take on a senior adviser's role, effective Jan. 1.  Separately on Wednesday, Liberty Broadband, which was spun off from Liberty Media in 2014, said it had agreed to merge with Charter Communications in an all-stock deal.

raw.headline: Liberty Media sharpens F1 focus with spinoff as Malone set to take driver's seat
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Formula One owner Liberty Media will sharpen its focus on its motorsports businesses by spinning off most of its other assets and said Chairman John Malone would become the interim CEO when its long-time top boss steps down at the end of 2024.  Greg Maffei, who spearheaded the company's rapid expansion across the media, communications, sports and entertainment sectors during his nearly two decades at the helm, will take on a senior adviser's role, effective Jan. 1.  Separately on Wednesday, Liberty Broadband, which was spun off from Liberty Media in 2014, said it had agreed to merge with Charter Communications in an all-stock deal.

headline: Charter to Buy Liberty Broadband as John Malone Moves to Simplify Empire
summary: Charter Communications agreed to acquire its largest shareholder, Liberty Broadband, in an all-stock deal, completing a back-and-forth negotiation. Liberty, as part of the deal, agreed to spin off its GCI subsidiary, an Alaskan communications provider.

raw.headline: Charter to Buy Liberty Broadband as John Malone Moves to Simplify Empire
raw.summary: Charter Communications agreed to acquire its largest shareholder, Liberty Broadband, in an all-stock deal, completing a back-and-forth negotiation. Liberty, as part of the deal, agreed to spin off its GCI subsidiary, an Alaskan communications provider.

headline: Liberty Media’s Maffei Steps Down, Capping Two-Decades of Deals
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Liberty Media Corp. Chief Executive Officer Greg Maffei will step down at the end of this year after nearly two decades of dealmaking at Chairman John Malone’s media, sports and telecom empire. headline: Charter to Acquire Liberty Broadband Corporation
summary: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHTR) (along with its subsidiaries, "Charter") and Liberty Broadband Corporation (NASDAQ: LBRDA, LBRDK, LBRDP) announced today that they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Charter has agreed to acquire Liberty Broadband in an all-stock transaction.
